text:
Anita Simonds, President @EuroRespSoc:
The role of #patients and #healthcareprofessionals is essential in bridging regulators and citizens when it comes to combating disinformation on vaccines. #FactsMatter #EMA25Years

Pat O'Mahony, former Chair of EMA's Management Board: Confidence from all stakeholders is of utmost importance and EMA as a leading international body commands this confidence & credibility. Please continue to collaborate in an open way across all stakeholders. #EMA25Years

Emer Cooke: The next big step in the #veterinary area, and which will also have major impact in the context of #AMR, will be the implementation of the new veterinary regulation. I am committed to ensuring the new rules can be readily applied as soon as possible. #EMA25Years

Emer Cooke: As more complex 💊💊 reach the market, we need to ensure that all #patients and healthcare systems in the 🇪🇺 can access and afford them. We will need to intensify our efforts to minimise shortages & increase medicines availability. #EMA25Years

Emer Cooke: #COVID19 should not be seen in isolation. There are other challenges in an environment which is dramatically changing. #AMR is a risk that will continue and it may also require a sustained global effort. #EMA25Years

Emer Cooke: EMA plays a crucial role in the response to #COVID19 as it supports the development & evaluation of treatments and vaccines against the virus. EMA is going to extraordinary lengths to support the availability of these 💊 to patients. #EMA25Years

Emer Cooke: EMA & the 💊 Network have built a solid foundation that protects public and animal health in Europe. Citizens in the 🇪🇺 can trust that the 💊 they take are safe, effective and of high quality, which is especially relevant in moments of crisis like #COVID19 #EMA25Years

Guido Rasi: In these years we went through challenges by working together, supported by the extraordinary people in our agencies and our stakeholders. I am convinced that all the experience and lessons learnt from the past 25 years have paved the way for the future. #EU25Years

Guido Rasi: Over 1,700 💊 have been approved in 25 years, including for #rarediseases, paediatrics & veterinary use. EMA and the Network apply a proactive approach to risk management and monitoring the safety and effectiveness of medicines on the market #EMA25Years

Guido Rasi, EMA's Executive Director: The Agency has been interacting with its stakeholders since its inception. I feel particularly proud of having put #patients’ views, needs and values at the top of the regulatory agenda. #EMA25Years

Guido Rasi: We've built a strong and reliable 🇪🇺 regulatory network with Member States & @EU_Commission. We have pooled together a large and robust network of experts ensuring regulatory excellence for EU 💊 and an effective and rapid response to #COVID19. #EMA25Years
